review_content: Very cute, decent non-toxic, non-stick pans for the price but cheaply made, thin metal. Pros and cons.  Be careful. Must be hand-washed immediately after each use or the bottom stays brown, and gets darker with each use. The non-stick surface scratches very easily. Plus side- They are really easy to clean, can even use a paper towel! They do distrubute heat evenly, and the pan heats quickly. Fried eggs really do slip right out of the pan! Great for minor cooking, like eggs, grilled cheese, steamed veggies, etc. Thin metal makes them light weight!  Color is a true, soft pink. (That makes it totally worth it!)Bottomline: If non-toxic is important to you & really want pink pots and pans (I did!) & if you don't mind carefully hand-washing, (sharp "lip") & don't expect them to last forever, these are terrific for the price. Hard to find a true non-toxic, non-stick set for under $100.  But if you're looking for a set that will last for several years, and can be used for heavy duty cooking, then buck up the extra $50 and get a Greenpan set.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: This is only my opinion that follows, but I am strongly recommending this cook wear set and here is why:I purchased this cookware set as a secondary  "back-up" support system  for my apartment kitchen. I have a small electric stove/range (coil inserts for the cooktop) and wanted to find a nice set of kitchen cookware that would be easy to clean, be durable and somewhat scratch resistant, while delivering even heat  preparing small to large size meals. I test drove this cookware set for yesterday for Thanksgiving, and each piece performed perfectly.  My main go-to is my cast iron cookware - but in my opinion, if you want to achieve slow cooker results, in taste, texture, appearance and full bodied flavor of what you will prepare - and excellent stove top results to boot - this wonderful set of pots and pans is ideal and a necessity in my and in any kitchen.The Trick is to NOT overheat the pots/pans that you chose to use. Slow and even medium heat applied is where this cookware really shines! I completely agree with the many reviews that strongly suggest low to medium heat to cook, and the manufacturer, Green Life has stated on the care and use guide enclosed with the set. It is normal that the non stick properties will diminish significantly due to prolonged exposure to high heat applied during cooking, especially when the prolonged use is from cooking oils which begin the breakdown into the carbonization process. This measure alone rapidly accelerates into severely damaging the ceramic finish and the aluminum double plate heating system on the bottom. I prepared a number of dishes, and chose to deep fry crab Rangoon implementing the 5 quart pot. The oil heated quickly over medium heat (the number 6 setting on my stove dial) and the Rangoon browned beautifully; very light and crispy. No oily touch or cold oil residue tastes. Systemic great design - the heating and ceramic coating mechanism performs very well!  I found I had always even heat -  quick, even and adjustable when needed to be -resulting in fabulous results in whatever you may choose to prepare. Sautee and stir frying works exceptionally well, and preparing tomato or non tomato based dishes (red and white varieties) were perfect. Great results! If you can use butter or a light oil in small application - that is on the mark!The set has a nice selection of sizes for the skillets and pots and pans. The smallest skillet is a perfect fit for a mini omelet or one fried egg wonder - The mini omelet in this little champ was pleasantly surprising - and also performed well when doing a mini crepe.Please be sure to allow adequate cooling of the cookware BEFORE you clean them. A simple wipe down with a soft clean cotton cloth or pre-crumpled paper towels to "tenderize" the coarseness of the towel before you hand wash them. There is a limited 2 year warranty, but with some TLC , this cook wear set will last a long, long time and have a wonderful extended life.The set comes with recommended utensils to prevent scratching and damaging of the ceramic surfaces. The glass lids and well balanced and have a great weight to them. In my opinion, the glass appears and performs as heavy duty, (though I would have liked to have had a port/vent in each lid to release steam). The heat resistant handles are a big plus in addition.I would NOT recommend oven use, as you would jeopardize and compromise the heat resistant handles, the heating plate technology, etc. in their construction and design. This set is ideal for non professional use and low to medium heat applications. Each piece well performed to the conditions /variables I have applied thus far. Stay away from dishwashers (in my opinion). I treat this set of cook wear as I do my cast iron - and it will and has paid off beautifully!I am only an intermediate experienced cook, but this cookware set is perfect and ideal for the paces I put it through.  Awesome set of cookware! Bravo, Green Life!
